H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H2070.def: = an insect with large composite eyes and a single pair of wings; ◄ |iMusca domestica|i*; ► these insects converge in swarms on (rotting) food, dung, and household garbage; ≈ associated with large quantities

H5042.def: exact meaning unsure; possibly: = process by which water flows in a rapid and plentiful stream

H887.def: = process by which objects such as dead animals, plants, or wounds give off a foul odor; ≈ considered repulsive

H7543.def: = causative action by which humans mix spices together or with food ► so as to produce a fragrant or tasty blend

H8081.def: = high quality {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>}, ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness

H4592.def: = small quantity of objects or substance

H3368.def: = state in which humans or objects are considered valuable and desirable

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H3225.def: = the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H8040.def: = the side of the human body which is to the north when facing the direction of the rising sun; in extension: one option as opposed to another

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H5530.def: = behavior of a person without good sense or wisdom

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H2638.def: = state in which humans lack something that they are supposed to have

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H4910.def: = state in which humans are similar in shape, behavior or experience to others

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H5117.def: = action by which humans or animals stop their current or regular activities, ► often with the purpose of recovering their strength

H4725.def: = a specific area or point in space

H4832.def: = causative action by which humans or deities help or cause (other) humans to be restored to health or physical strength after a disease or an accident

H2399.def: = state in which a human being is responsible for a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether committed on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H8121.def: = celestial body ► that marks day and night and produces warmth and light for the earth

H7684.def: = action by which humans act wrongly, though without the intention to do so

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H7989.def: = a person in a position of high authority

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H4791.def: = a position of a relatively high elevation above the earth

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H5483.def: = large domesticated solid-hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot

H8269.def: = someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H2658.def: = action by which animals strike the ground with their feet

H1475.def: = a hole in the ground; ◄ produced by digging; ► often camouflaged to be used to trap animals; ≈ camouflaged pits were hard to see and people were susceptible to fall into them

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H6555.def: = process by which a container bursts open due to abundance of contents

H1447.def: = a continuous vertical structure, usually made of natural stones, that encloses or divides an area of land; ≈ associated with security; in some cases used figuratively to denote integrity, which can be negatively affected by sin

H5391.def: = action by which a person or animal uses teeth to cut into something, like another person or animal

H5175.def: = long legless reptile without eyelids or external ears; it moves by wriggling or gliding; some species have a poisonous bite; ≈ symbol of lurking, unexpected danger; associated with lies, deception, and misleading teaching

H5265.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from another object into which it had been inserted or attached in a different way

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H1234.def: = process by which an object is split, either partially or completely, either by supernatural means or by violence

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H1270.def: = a strong, hard magnetic silvery-grey metal, ► used in construction and manufacturing; ≈ associated with strength and permanence

H6949.def: exact meaning unknown; = process by which one's teeth are affected by the eating of sour grapes, and become blunt, numb, or adversely affected in another way

H7043.def: = state in which animals and objects have the ability to move or act with speed ◄ due to lack of weight, agility, strength, training, or energy

H1396.def: = process by which humans gain strength, power, and authority, which enables them to do things that others are unable to accomplish

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H3504.def: = something that is of benefit to humans; often used in rhetorical questions suggesting that nothing is of benefit at all in a certain situation

H3787.def: = state in which a matter is considered to be the appropriate thing to do

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H5175.def: = long legless reptile without eyelids or external ears; it moves by wriggling or gliding; some species have a poisonous bite; ≈ symbol of lurking, unexpected danger; associated with lies, deception, and misleading teaching

H5391.def: = action by which a person or animal uses teeth to cut into something, like another person or animal

H3908.def: = action by which people talk softly among themselves to keep others from overhearing

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H3504.def: = something that is of benefit to humans; often used in rhetorical questions suggesting that nothing is of benefit at all in a certain situation

H1167.def: = person exercising authority over people, animals, or inanimate objects in the role of owner, ruler, or husband

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H2580.def: = state in which someone or something is physically attractive; ► which may bring about a favorable attitude in others

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H1104.def: = action by which humans or animals cause food to pass down from their mouth to their esophagus; ≈ often used figuratively to denote destruction and death

H319.def: = pertaining to being located far behind other objects in a row, in a direction away from the spectator; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was with their backs facing the East, this term presupposes a westerly direction

H1948.def: = state in which an action is regarded as abnormal and associated with people who are insane

H5530.def: = behavior of a person without good sense or wisdom

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H5046.def: = causative action by which humans pass on information to others, usually by word of mouth

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H3021.def: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious activity which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H337.def: = area located near the sea and/or the people living there; ≈ associated with commerce, remoteness, paganism, but also called on to acknowledge YHWH

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H5288.def: = a young male, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people; ≈ typically regarded as healthy and physically strong, but also lacking the experience and wisdom of the {L:older men<SDBH:זָקֵן>}

H8269.def: = someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H1242.def: = first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H2715.def: = empty, open place ◄ in a solid body

H8269.def: = someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H1369.def: = the ability to accomplish great things because of characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H8358.def: exact meaning unsure: = type of cloth, either woven or knitted

H4746.def: exact meaning unsure; probably: = structure consisting of beams and other woodwork forming the roof of a building; ≈ requires proper maintenance

H4355.def: = process by which a flat object bulges downwards through weight, pressure, or lack of strength

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H1811.def: = state in which an object has a hole or crack in it, so that liquids or other objects can pass through

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H7814.def: = action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H8055.def: = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7043.def: = state in which animals and objects have the ability to move or act with speed ◄ due to lack of weight, agility, strength, training, or energy

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H4093.def: literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly

H2315.def: = area enclosed by walls or partitions, floor, and ceiling; ◄ part of building

H4904.def: = state in which humans are lying down to rest

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H1167.def: = person exercising authority over people, animals, or inanimate objects in the role of owner, ruler, or husband

H3671.def: = part of body; ◄ of bird, insect, celestial creature; ► used for flying but also to give protection

H5046.def: = causative action by which humans pass on information to others, usually by word of mouth
